It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a short, creeping stem with small, clustered leaves. The plant produces distinctive, elongated, yellowish flowers that are typically borne in dense inflorescences. It is native to a very limited geographic range, primarily found in specific regions of South America. Due to its restricted habitat and low population numbers, Ambelania zschokkeiformis is considered an endangered species.
